description.narrative: Purple Roof Women's Shelter Foundation (Mor Çati) har inkommit med en ansökan till Sida om 16,2 miljoner SEK för finansiering av deras strategiska plan 2020-2022 (avtalets aktivitetsperiod juli 2020 - juni 2023). Insatsens avser stärka kampen mot våld mot kvinnor i Turkiet, påverka offentlig politik i syfte att stärka och förbättra stödmekanismer för kvinnor som utsatts för våld samt att öka allmänhetens medvetenhet om jämställdhet och om frågor rörande våld mot kvinnor. Insatsens totala budget är cirka 22,4 miljoner SEK, varav 6,2 miljoner SEK kommer från andra europeiska givare, inklusive Europeiska Kommissionen och den Nederländska ambassaden.

Purple Roof Women’s Shelter Foundation has applied to Sida for funding of SEK 16,2 Million for their strategic plan 2020-2023 (agreement's activity period July 2020 - June 2023). The intervention aims to strengthen the struggle against Violence against Women (VAW) in Turkey, influence public policies to strengthen and improve support mechanisms for women victims of VAW, as well as to raise public awareness on gender equality and VAW. The intervention’s total budget is approximately SEK 22,4 Million, out of which 6,2 million SEK is contributed by other European donors including European Commission and the Embassy of the Netherlands.

Strategic Objectives: Strategic Objective 1: Increase women’s solidarity to strengthen the struggle against VAW in Turkey Strategic Objective 2: Influence public policies to strengthen and improve support mechanisms to women for combatting with VAW Strategic Objective 3: Raising public awareness on gender equality and VAW

sector.narrative: Women’s rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

tag.narrative: 5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.

title.narrative: 11669- Agreement with Purple Roof on Women's Shelter Project
11669- Decision on Contribution for the Purple Roof Women's Shelter Project

description.narrative: The report provided by the organisation is assessed to be highly detailed but has also managed to capture some important changes and results even in the first 6 months of implementation in 2020. The report, for each outcome, provides a detailed description of activities and highlighted their key achievements. Purple Roof (PR) in this first six months has adapted itself very well to the conditions of the new normal and the pandemic in terms of both services they provide and the organisation’s working methods. They have realised all the conditions of the agreement articles relevant to the period, under the special conditions and are also cleared with Sida and by the audit performed. PR in this period continued their main activities under the solidarity center and the shelter as planned including refugee and immigrant women. They have also reported that by the help of the Sida funds they have also improved the physical conditions of the shelter. PR has also reported on some positive behavioural change examples from the women who received support from them. PR has also shown efforts to increase the sustainability of their activities and modified and improved some of their work areas, increased the staff capacity by numbers and quality. The legal and psychological support capacity has been expanded. They have increased the quality of support and the methods offered to children and adolescents. PR has also supported grassroots NGOs at the local level. In this period with the increased support of Sida, the number of women who received psychological support has increased. Through their work they have continued to keep the state offices accountable and has managed to take part in the meeting on “4th National Action Plan on Combating Violence Against Women” as a stakeholder, being the leading women organization in the field of VAW organized by Ministry of Family, Labour and Social Services. This is assessed to be a very important achievement in terms of NGO government relations. Another important development was that, Ministry of Family, Labour and Social Services recommended PR to be consulted about the content of the police registration form, indicating the risk analysis on violence cases, which is included within the tasks of the Ministry of Interior. PR has also maintained their relations with Istanbul Metropolitan Municipality, Ankara Metropolitan Municipality, Istanbul Governor, Besiktas Municipality, Sisli Municipality, Violence Prevention and Monitoring Centre in Istanbul, Bar Association at Istanbul and attended the Coordination Meeting of Istanbul Metropolitan Municipality and also developed new relations with AKP led-Beyoglu Municipality, Bodrum Municipality, Findikli Municipality. They have also reported that not only the relations with municipalities have improved but also municipalities started to take concrete steps for combating VAW. As a result, it has been assessed that they have strengthened relations with public institutions, created further solidarity with women and various other institutions. They have actively campaigned and provided reports regarding the developments on the Istanbul Convention and other negativities and reached high numbers of audience. PR has established communication and permanent relations with new institutions (municipalities, public institutions, private clinics, online initiatives, etc.) to which women and children can be directed. The quality of the work has been also strengthened in this regard. It has been possible for women to meet with experts in line with their needs in response to the pandemic. A very important activity is within the organizational capacity building work, where PR has started a Personal Data Protection Law compliance process. This process is also introduced as a best practice through Sida’s initiative to the other organisations that Sida supports which also collects sensitive data. This issue was also mentioned within the QAC process and has been eagerly dealt with by PR in the implementation period. More on organisational capacity they have also created an Anti-Corruption and Bribery Policy, a Procurement Policy as well as Financial Affairs Policy Document. In addition to these, they started to work on the evaluation and monitoring of activities. The organisation is currently receiving M&E training provided by Sida. It can be said that the organisation has already made use of their M&E studies which can be seen from the quality of the report.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
